title: Twitter, Disney, Mattel, Twilio, Tesla: What to Watch in the Stock Market Today; Disney added nearly 12 million subscribers to its streaming service; Mattel reported better-than-expected earnings during the holidays
text:
* Twilio reported revenue growth in the fourth quarter and issued guidance for the upcoming quarter.

* Uber's fourth-quarterly revenue climbed, helped by a recovery in its rides business and continued demand for food delivery, despite restaurant reopenings.

* Disney said it added nearly 12 million streaming subscriptions and reported record revenue at its domestic parks and resorts.

* Mattel posted better-than-expected revenue and earnings for the holiday quarter.

* Datadog reported better-than-expected quarterly results and gave an upbeat outlook.

* Lumen Technologies swung to an annual profit last year from a loss in 2020.

* PepsiCo reported fourth-quarter profit and revenue that topped expectations, boosted its dividend and set a new $10 billion stock repurchase program.

* Coca-Cola reported fourth-quarter earnings and revenue that beat expectations.

* Interpublic Group raised its quarterly dividend and authorized the resumption of the advertising company's share-repurchase program.

* Kellogg also delivered an earnings beat.

* Equifax reported higher profit in the fourth quarter, with growth at its human resources service business boosting revenue.

* A California regulatory agency said it filed a lawsuit against Tesla, alleging racial discrimination and harassment at the electric-vehicle maker.

* Yelp and Zillow are due to report results after the close.

Chart of the Day

* Who is feeling the price squeeze the most? Here is a demographic breakdown of inflation's impacts.

Write to James Willhite at james.willhite@wsj.com
